forum.name: updates
forum.description: find out what's new with anylad. feature announcements and bug fix info. thanks all!
forum.latestCommentText: im gonna miss it for sure

thread.title: Light Limits probing & fps display

comments.text: Hi all! Version 158.5 (you're on [version]) has a new Me -> ... -> More settings page to adjust limits + show the current frame rate!
This first of what may be multiple updates covers your personalized, temporary limits, to probe lag; you can tune Thing, Lights, and Shade Lights limits.
Future updates here may then relate to area-persistent settings, new universal defaults, as well as per-light tuning settings like "doesn't cast shadows".
And when hitting the new "Show frame rate" button, you'll find the current FPS printed in the middle of your view (90 being the optimal/ default).
thanks for this, playing around with lights is interesting and as far as i cant tell their effect on framerate is close to negligible.
shade lights do way more to affect frames if pushed overboard.
zid i feel i observed the exact same -- more non-shadow lights are fine, while shadow-lights eat up frames! could inspire us to add more lights by default for everyone perhaps.
... though my tests were in an area where i was at  a down limit of constant45 fps to begin with, so might need more testing...

thread.latestCommentText: ... though my tests were in an area where i was at  a down limit of constant45 fps to begin with, so might need more testing...
